channel.title: Comments on: Post 300 or why all developers should be blogging
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Andy Warren
item.dc:creator: Andy Warren
item.description: Nice post Denis, very well said.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Yes, remember when the Kaspersky site was hacked with a <strong>SQL Injection</strong>? Not a good thing
item.content:encoded: Yes, remember when the Kaspersky site was hacked with a SQL Injection? Not a good thing

item.title: By: mario
item.dc:creator: mario
item.description: One more point. While it's beneficial to publish code in a nice presentatial style, you should also consider your blog provider or software. It for example doesn't add credibility if you blog about security, but use Wordpress.
item.content:encoded: One more point. While it’s beneficial to publish code in a nice presentatial style, you should also consider your blog provider or software. It for example doesn’t add credibility if you blog about security, but use WordPress.

item.title: By: Skilldrick
item.dc:creator: Skilldrick
item.description: Yes, it's definitely helpful to blog - I've only just started, but the research I put into each post really pays off. It's a very useful technique for deepening your knowledge (when you mainly have breadth).
item.content:encoded: Yes, it’s definitely helpful to blog – I’ve only just started, but the research I put into each post really pays off. It’s a very useful technique for deepening your knowledge (when you mainly have breadth).

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Good point, Aaron.

I wish I blogged more, but I simply don’t have much ideas about what to blog about.

item.title: By: AaronBertrand
item.dc:creator: AaronBertrand
item.description: Yes, I blog, and yes, it continues to make me a better dork. Most importantly because I state my opinions, and have to defend them when challenged - this helps me question the technical choices I've made and gives me better ammunition the next time I need to make a decision. Without blogging about some of my solutions, the only way I'd know if they were good or bad ideas is if I happened to come across someone else who solved the same problem in the same way - highly unlikely.
item.content:encoded: Yes, I blog, and yes, it continues to make me a better dork. Most importantly because I state my opinions, and have to defend them when challenged – this helps me question the technical choices I’ve made and gives me better ammunition the next time I need to make a decision. Without blogging about some of my solutions, the only way I’d know if they were good or bad ideas is if I happened to come across someone else who solved the same problem in the same way – highly unlikely.

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: congrats on 300 denis. and... i dunno, i don't blog enough!
item.content:encoded: congrats on 300 denis. and… i dunno, i don’t blog enough!

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
Great post Denis. Whenever I find myself wondering whether I should write about something or not I find myself thinking of Jeremy Miller’s “should I blog” post (http://codebetter.com/blogs/jeremy.miller/archive/2008/01/25/should-i-blog.aspx) – the answer is almost always “YES!”

Hopefully this post will do the same for others.

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.description: You're just trying to shame the rest of us into writing something, aren't you?
item.content:encoded: You’re just trying to shame the rest of us into writing something, aren’t you?

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
300 is a huge accomplishment Denis and all of us at LTD thank you for all the work.

I owe you special thanks because you were a big person that motivated me to start blogging when I did.
